original: ANDR^, Eskil Folke Valdemar, Jägmästare, Jönköping, f Motala 6/2 09 av kyrkoh E A o Sigrid Andersson, gm Kerstin Falle-nius. Studex Sthlm 27, ex KSH h kurs 33. Anst h skogsv.styr i Jkp 33—34, vkst dir f Jkps l skogsägarefrn sed. 34. Ag fastigh Pollux 5 i Jkp. Led Jkps l vedkont 39-^40, dess vägklassif.nmd sed. 41. Led Jkps l föreningsråd sed. 37. Odd Fellow. Hobby: Fiske. ANDRÉ, Frans Arvid, Kontorschef, Stockholm, f Liljendals Br, Ramen, Värml, 4/10 81 av trädg.m A J Andersson-André o Elisabet Eriksson, gm Hilda Svenson. Priv elem.under-visn, hdlssk. Hdlselev i brukshdl o br.elev Ramens Br 00, br.bokh Bofors Kanonverkst räkenskapskont 01—06, avräkn.bokf o expeditör Hults Br Ögl 06—08, bokf o kamr.ass Hällefors Br Västml 09—13, kass o bokf Trolanders järn-hdl Kopparberg 13, kamr fma Henning Johans- son Sthlm 14—15, kamr Mjölkcentralen Sthlm 15—32, kont.ch o ek.ch där sed. 32. Av trycket: Medarb 81 års mäns minnesskr. Frimurare, Frisinn klbn Sthlm, Värml sällsk Sthlm. Hobbies: Litteratur o konst. ANDRÉ, Per August Sture, Disponent, Strömsnäsbruk, f Sillhövda, Blek, 10/7 95 av grhdl o v. konsul J A A o Charlotta Kind-borg, gm Astrid Wijkström. Studex Kkrona 13, KTH (eltekn) 14—18. Driftsing Västerås kraftvk 18—21, anst SKF :s sydamer org 22— 31 (övering argentinska dtrbol 22—26, vkst dir brasil d:o 27—31), anst AB Ljungströms Ångturbin (licensförsäljn) 32—33, disp Strömsnäs Bruks AB sed. 33. Led Sv Tekn.frn. ANDRÉASSON, Johan Edwin, Grosshandlare, Uddevalla, f Färgelanda 1/12 90 av jord-br A A o h h f Magnusson, gm Hedvig Arvidsson. Efter avslut skolgång genomg hdlsinst i Uvalla. Arist i fma J A Zetterkvist 05 —06, anst som hdlsbitr i Hanson & Hasselbergs Speceri- o Skeppsfourn.affär, Uvalla, 06—19, övert dna fma 19 o bedriver den sed. dess. övertog Hanson & Hasselbergs i Uvalla engrosrörelse 32. Ag två fastigh i Uvalla. Ordf Uvalla Köpm.frn:s specerigrupp sed. fi år, v. ordf Uvalla Köpm.frn, ordf Uvalla Kreditsystem, ordf Bohusl Köpm.frb o dess spe-ceribr.avd, led Gbgs o Bohusl samarb.nmd, v. ordf i stdsflm, led gas- o elverksstyr, led tax.nmdn, led nmdn f 1-åriga hdlsskolan, rev f Uvalla allm Ivks byggn.fond, led hamntaxe-beredn, styr.led v AB Gbgs Hdlsbanks avd.-kont Uvalla, besiktn.man f skador å varor, led kristidsstyr. Medl Uvalla Turistfrn, Uvalla Rotaryklubb. Frimurare, Odd Fellow. Sv:s Köpm.frbs Ht g. Resor: Engl, Norge, Danm. °ANDRÉEN, Ivar Jakob Konrad, I/agerchef, Gävle, f Avaström, Hille, Gvlbgs l, 20/12 90 av sågv.arb A G A o h h, f Hedman, gm Tekla Eriksson. Efter avslutad skolgång anst v Avaströms Sågverk 02—04, v Sköldströms Hembageri, Gävle, 04—07, h B Södergrens Tekn Fabrik, Gävle, 07—09, h F Ahlgrens Tekn Fabriks AB (Läkerolfabr), Gävle, sed. 10, lagerchef där. IOGT. Tempelriddare. Patr-stGM. 0 ANDRÉN, Adolf Bertil, Järnhandlare, Falkenberg, f Växjö 23/6 84 av red C L Andersson o Alma Sandgren, gm Helfrid Lundgren. Inneh fma Bröderna Wijklund Järn- & Redskapshandel (grund 89). Styr.led i AB Gbgs Bks avd.kont o AB Dan Lundgrens Läderfabr. Stdsflm 18—20 o sed. 30, led av drätselk fr 21, ordf å dess 3 :e avd, led av kyrkoflm o kyrkoråd, ordf i arb.lösh.komm. ANDRÉN, Johan Conradi, Köpman, Stockholm, f. Sthlm 5/3 65 av bruksarb J Andersson o Johanna Lilja, gm Gunhild Antoni. Borgarsk. Spec.hdl 92. Stdflm 15—19, led hälsov.nmdn 15—20, en av borgarsk 50 äldste, dess bemedl.komm 14, flm Sthlms hdlskamm 24—37. Ordf o sekr Sthlms spec.handl.frn 02—35, styr.led Sv allm hdlsfrn o Sv köpm.frb sed. 11 mm. Av trycket: Mercuriiordens hist 10, Sthlms spec.handl.frns hist 17. RNO, HVO, Köpm.förbs stGM. ANDRÉN, Gustaf Vilhelm, Direktör, Malmö, f Malmö 15/9 01 av ing P W A o h h f Nilsson, gm Bertha Johansson. Studex, hdlsinst,fil kand StHS. Kamr Jkps L Tidn 25—29, Sv miss.frb 29—30, kamr o kont.ch Förl.AB i Malmö o Sydsv Dagbl Snällp fr 30, kassadir fr 36. Styr.led Sydsv Dagbl AB, sekr o kassa-förv Sv tidn.utg.frns S kr, styr.suppl KFUM:s riksfrb, v. ordf dess S krets, styr.led KFUM i Malmö, medl KFUM:s scoutfrbs högkv o ordf Malmökårens kårkv. Resor: Engl 34, Tyskl o Ung 37. "ANDRÉN, Lars Hugo, Möbelhandlare, Laholm, f Laholm 4/12 83 av handl O Andersson 0 Leontine Flygare, gm Alma Nilsson. Inneh fma Hugo Andrén, manuf o möbler, samt snickerirörelse o möbeltillverkn. Stdsflm samt led av arb.lösh.ktén o fattigv.styr 34, kassör 1 Mod Valmansfrn i Laholm 32. ANDRÉN, John Lennart, Fil Doktor, Berjrs-ingrenjör, Ystad, f Ystad 16/10 90 av bankdir •INA o Christine Ekelin, gm Agnes Wallin?. Mog.ex Ystad 08, stud v univ Lund, Heidelberg o Upps 08—18, fil kand 11, fil mag 12, fil lic 17, fil dr 18, KTH 19—21, avg.ex där sistn år. Vik lekt i fys o mat v h a l Nykpg 21—22, anst v elektr smältverk o masugnar h Illinois Steel Co, Chicago, o hos United Alloy Steel Corp, Canton, Ohio, 23, elektr stålsmäl-tare h Jessop Steel Co, Washington. Pä, 23— 25, chefsmetallurg h American Chain Co konc, Bridgeport, Conn, USA, 25—32. övertog 32 faderns fma L Andrén & Co i Ystad (grund av fad 79). Led av Ystads stads byggn.nmd sed. 33 samt av planteringsstyr. Uttagit div pat rör tillv av rostfr stål, svetsn i allm av .järn o legeringar o därm sammanh problem. Sammankall i Skånes Järnhandl.frns valutskott. Ag fastigh i Ystad o villafastigh i Ystads Sandskog. Resor: Tyskl 14—16 o 22, USA 22—32. Led av TNI i "Ystad. Av trycket: »Zählung und Messung der komplexen Molekiile einiger Dämpfe nach einer neuen Kondensationstheorie» (grad.avh 18). Led Sv Tekn.frn. Hobbies: Golf, schack. ANDRÉN, Anders Vilhelm, Civilingenjör, Jönköping, f Jönkp 18/3 08 av ing Fredr A o Augusta Nilsson, gm Inga Knutsson. Studex Jönkp 27, KTH (V o V) 28-^33. Ing AB Skånska Cementgjuteriets Jönkpsavd 33, avd.-ch där sed. 36, Stadsrev i Jönkp. Led av Sv Tekn.frn. Resor: Tyskl o Danm 31.
translated:
ANDR^, Eskil Folke Valdemar, Forest Supervisor, Jönköping, born in Motala on 6th February 1909 to church Minister E A and Sigrid Andersson, married to Kerstin Falle-nius. Studied in Stockholm in 1927, graduated from KSH course in 1933. Employed by the Forestry Authority in Jönköping from 1933-1934, then became the Managing Director for Jönköping's forest owners from 1934 onwards. Owns property Pollux 5 in Jönköping. Member of Jönköping's firewood control board from 1939-1940, and the road classification committee since 1941. Member of Jönköping's association council since 1937. Also a member of the Odd Fellow fraternity. Hobby: Fishing.

ANDRÉ, Frans Arvid, Office Manager, Stockholm, born in Liljendal Br, Ramen, Värmland on 4th October 1881 to gardener A J Andersson-André and Elisabet Eriksson, married to Hilda Svenson. Private elementary education, attended commercial school. Apprentice in trade and commercial employee at Ramens Br in 1900, bookkeeper at Bofors Kanonverkst accounting department from 1901-1906, bookkeeper and clerk at Hults Br Ögl from 1906-1908, bookkeeper and assistant cashier at Hällefors Br Västmland from 1909-1913, cashier and bookkeeper at Trolanders iron trade in Kopparberg from 1913, clerk for Henning Johansson in Stockholm from 1914-1915, clerk at the Mjölkcentralen in Stockholm from 1915-1932, and office manager and financial manager there since 1932. Published: Contributor to the 1981 men's memory book. Member of the Freemasons, Frisinn Club in Stockholm, and Värmland Society in Stockholm. Hobbies: Literature and art.

ANDRÉ, Per August Sture, Manager, Strömsnäsbruk, born in Sillhövda, Blekinge on 10th July 1895 to farmer J A A and Charlotta Kindborg, married to Astrid Wijkström. Graduated from Kkrona in 1913, studied electrical engineering at KTH from 1914-1918. Worked at Västerås power plant from 1918-1921, employed by SKF's South American organization from 1922-1931 (head of Argentine subsidiary from 1922-1926, growth director for Brazilian subsidiary from 1927-1931), employed by AB Ljungströms Ångturbin (license sales) from 1932-1933, and became the manager of Strömsnäs Bruks AB in 1933. Member of the Swedish Technical Association.

ANDRÉASSON, Johan Edwin, Wholesale Merchant, Uddevalla, born in Färgelanda on 1st December 1890 to farmer A A and Magnusson, married to Hedvig Arvidsson. Completed commercial education in Uddevalla. Worked for J A Zetterkvist in 1905-1906, then employed as a commercial assistant at Hanson & Hasselberg's grocery and ship chandler's store in Uddevalla from 1906-1919. Took over the business in 1919 and has been running it since then. Took over Hanson & Hasselberg's wholesale business in Uddevalla in 1932. Owns two properties in Uddevalla. Chairman of Uddevalla Merchant Association's grocery group for five years, vice chairman of Uddevalla Merchant Association, chairman of Uddevalla Credit system, chairman of Bohuslän Merchant Association and its grocery department, member of Gothenburg and Bohuslän cooperation committee, vice chairman of city film, member of gas and power plant board, member of tax committee, member of one-year commercial school committee, auditor of Uddevalla public building fund, member of harbor tax committee, board member of AB Gothenburg Commercial Bank Uddevalla branch office, inspection of damages to goods, member of wartime committee. Member of Uddevalla Tourist Association, Uddevalla Rotary Club. Freemason, Odd Fellow. Swedish Merchant Association honorary member. Travels to England, Norway, and Denmark.

ANDRÉEN, Ivar Jakob Konrad, Warehouse Manager, Gävle, born in Avaström, Hille, Gävleborg on 20th December 1890 to sawmill worker A G A and Hedman, married to Tekla Eriksson. Worked at Avaströms Sågverk from 1902-1904, Sköldströms Hembageri in Gävle from 1904-1907, B Södergrens Tekn Fabrik in Gävle from 1907-1909, and F Ahlgrens Tekn Fabriks AB (Läkerolfabr) in Gävle since 1910, where he currently serves as the warehouse manager. Member of IOGT. Templar Knight. Patriotic Order of Templars.

ANDRÉN, Adolf Bertil, Iron Merchant, Falkenberg, born in Växjö on 23rd June 1884 to editor C L Andersson and Alma Sandgren, married to Helfrid Lundgren. Runs the company Bröderna Wijklund Järn- & Redskapshandel (established in 1889). Board member of AB Gothenburg Bank and AB Dan Lundgren's Leather Factory. Member of the city council from 1918, chairman of its 3rd department, member of the church council and church board, chairman of the unemployment committee.

ANDRÉN, Johan Conradi, Merchant, Stockholm, born in Stockholm on 5th March 1865 to factory worker J Andersson and Johanna Lilja, married to Gunhild Antoni. Attendee of the City Commercial School in 1892. City council member from 1915-1919, member of the health board from 1915-1920, one of the fifty elders, member of the city council's financial committee in 1914, member of the Stockholm Merchants' Association from 1924-1937. Chairman and secretary of Stockholm's merchants' association from 1902-1935, board member of the Swedish General Traders' Association and Swedish Merchant Association since 1911, etc. Published: "Mercuriiorders History" in 1910. Owner of the Royal Order of the North Star (RNO), His Majesty's Orders (HVO), and Swedish Merchant Association's honorary member.

ANDRÉN, Gustaf Vilhelm, Director, Malmö, born in Malmö on 15th September 1901 to Engineer P W A and Nilsson, married to Bertha Johansson. Graduated from high school, commercial institute, and received a bachelor's degree in philosophy from StHS. Employed by Jkps L Tidn from 1925-1929, Swedish Missions Fraternity from 1929-1930, and cashier and chief accountant for Förlags AB in Malmö and Sydsv Dagbl Snällp from 1930, and has been the financial director since 1936. Board member of Sydsv Dagbl AB, secretary, and treasurer of the Swedish Newspaper Production Company's insurance fund, board member substitute for KFUM's national association, vice chairman of its S district, board member of KFUM in Malmö, member of KFUM's scout association's headquarters and chairman of Malmö troop's troop council. Travels to England in 1934 and Germany and Hungary in 1937.

ANDRÉN, Lars Hugo, Furniture Merchant, Laholm, born in Laholm on 4th December 1883 to merchant O Andersson and Leontine Flygare, married to Alma Nilsson. Runs the company Hugo Andrén, manufacturer and furniture, as well as a carpentry business and furniture manufacturing. Member of the unemployment committee and poor relief board since 1934, treasurer of the Modern Valman's Association in Laholm since 1932.

ANDRÉN, John Lennart, PhD, Engineer, Ystad, born in Ystad on 16th October 1890 to bank director A and Christine Ekelin, married to Agnes Wallin. Graduated from Ystad in 1908, studied at Lund University, Heidelberg, and Uppsala from 1908-1918, received a bachelor's degree in philosophy in 1911, master's in philosophy in 1912, doctorate in philosophy in 1917, and studied at KTH from 1919-1921, graduated from there. Temporary lecturer in physics and mathematics in Nyköping from 1921-1922, employed at the electrical smelter and blast furnaces at Illinois Steel Co in Chicago, and at United Alloy Steel Corp in Canton, Ohio in 1923, electrical steel smelter at Jessop Steel Co in Washington, Pä, from 1923-1925, chief metallurgist at American Chain Co's plant in Bridgeport, Conn, USA from 1925-1932. Took over his father's company L Andrén & Co in Ystad in 1932. Member of Ystad's city building committee since 1933, and of the plantation committee. Developed various patents for the production of stainless steel pipes, general welding of iron and alloys, and related issues. Called for meetings in Skåne Iron Trade Union's currency committee. Owns property in Ystad and a villa in Ystad Sandskog. Travels to Germany from 1914-1916 and 1922, and the USA from 1922-1932. Member of TNI in Ystad. Published: "Counting and Measuring the Complex Molecules of Some Vapors According to a New Condensation Theory" (doctoral thesis in 1918). Member of the Swedish Technical Association. Hobbies: Golf, chess.

ANDRÉN, Anders Vilhelm, Civil Engineer, Jönköping, born in Jönköping on 18th March 1908 to Engineer Fredr A and Augusta Nilsson, married to Inga Knutsson. Graduated from Jönköping in 1927, KTH (mechanical and electrical engineering) from 1928-1933. Engineer at AB Skånska Cementgjuteriets Jönköping branch from 1933, department head since 1936, and city auditor in Jönköping. Member of the Swedish Technical Association. Travels to Germany and Denmark in 1931.
